results.title: Insulin resistance: The role in comorbid type 2 diabetes mellitus and depression.
results.text_hl: Concurrently, certain antidiabetic agents show promise in managing @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@sodium-glucose cotransporter-2@@@ inhibitors may be prioritized for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ at risk for @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@, while @GENE_GLP1R @GENE_2740 @@@glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor@@@ agonists appear particularly beneficial for @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@-related @<m>DISEASE_Mood_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019964 @@@mood disturbances@@@.

results.title: Increased risk of affective disorders in type 2 diabetes is minimized by sulfonylurea and metformin combination: a population-based cohort study
results.text_hl: Neither @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylureas@@@ nor @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ alone were associated with a significant change in @<m>DISEASE_Mood_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019964 @@@AD@@@ incidence.

results.title: A "glucose eater" drug as a therapeutic agent in psychiatry.
results.journal: J Psychosoc Nurs Ment Health Serv
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has the potential effect of inducing hippocampal neurogenesis, and additional studies of this drug are warranted in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Mood_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019964 @@@mood or cognitive disorders@@@.

results.title: Pathways to new drug discovery in neuropsychiatry
results.text_hl: Serendipitous discoveries, based on astute clinical observation or data mining, remain a valid option, as is illustrated by the suggestion in the paper by Wahlqvist and colleagues that treatment with @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylurea@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduces the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Mood_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019964 @@@affective disorder@@@.
